options.text: Extraverted (E): Enjoy social activities and gain energy from interacting with others
Introverted (I): Prefer solitude or small group interactions and gain energy from self-reflection

questions.text: Your way of gathering information tends to be:

options.text: Sensing (S): Focus on realistic, concrete information and details
Intuition (N): Focus on abstract possibilities and overall patterns

questions.text: When making decisions, you value more:

options.text: Thinking (T): Logical, objective and fair analysis
Feeling (F): Personal values, relationships and emotional factors
Judging (J): Prefer structure, planning and decisive action
Perceiving (P): Prefer flexibility, spontaneity and keeping options open
Actively interact with many people and enjoy being the center of attention
Talk with a few close friends or prefer to observe quietly

questions.text: When learning new things, you prefer:

options.text: Step-by-step learning with clear examples and practical applications
Understanding the big picture first, then exploring possibilities and connections

questions.text: When facing conflicts, you tend to:

options.text: Analyze the situation objectively and seek logical solutions
Consider everyone's feelings and seek harmonious solutions
Make detailed plans and follow schedules strictly
Adapt flexibly and handle things as they come
Participating in group activities and discussions
Having quiet time alone to think and reflect

questions.text: When solving problems, you rely more on:

options.text: Past experience and proven methods
Innovation and exploring new possibilities

questions.text: You make important decisions based more on:

options.text: Rational analysis and objective criteria
Personal values and impact on people

questions.text: You prefer your living environment to be:

options.text: Organized, tidy with everything in its place
Flexible, casual and adaptable to changes
Think out loud and share ideas as they come
Think carefully before speaking and prefer listening
Facts, details and what actually happened
Meanings, implications and what could be possible

questions.text: When giving feedback, you focus more on:

options.text: Being honest and direct about what needs improvement
Being tactful and considering the person's feelings
Starting early and working steadily toward completion
Working best under pressure and finishing just in time

INTJ.name: The Architect
INTJ.description: Imaginative and strategic thinkers, with a plan for everything. INTJs are independent, decisive, and have strong convictions. They see the big picture and are natural leaders in implementing their vision.

INTP.name: The Thinker
INTP.description: Innovative inventors with an unquenchable thirst for knowledge. INTPs are logical, analytical, and objective. They love theoretical concepts and abstract thinking.

ENTJ.name: The Commander
ENTJ.description: Bold, imaginative and strong-willed leaders, always finding a way or making one. ENTJs are natural-born leaders who are confident, assertive, and strategic in their approach.

ENTP.name: The Debater
ENTP.description: Smart and curious thinkers who cannot resist an intellectual challenge. ENTPs are innovative, enthusiastic, and love exploring new ideas and possibilities.

INFJ.name: The Advocate
INFJ.description: Quiet and mystical, yet very inspiring and tireless idealists. INFJs are creative, insightful, and principled. They have a strong sense of purpose and integrity.

INFP.name: The Mediator
INFP.description: Poetic, kind and altruistic people, always eager to help a good cause. INFPs are idealistic, loyal, and adaptable. They value harmony and authenticity.

ENFJ.name: The Protagonist
ENFJ.description: Charismatic and inspiring leaders, able to mesmerize their listeners. ENFJs are warm, empathetic, and responsible. They are natural teachers and mentors.

ENFP.name: The Campaigner
ENFP.description: Enthusiastic, creative and sociable free spirits, who can always find a reason to smile. ENFPs are energetic, optimistic, and love connecting with people.

ISTJ.name: The Logistician
ISTJ.description: Practical and fact-minded, reliable and responsible. ISTJs are organized, hardworking, and traditional. They value stability and have a strong sense of duty.

ISFJ.name: The Protector
ISFJ.description: Very dedicated and warm protectors, always ready to defend their loved ones. ISFJs are caring, loyal, and conscientious. They have a strong desire to serve others.

ESTJ.name: The Executive
ESTJ.description: Excellent administrators, unsurpassed at managing things or people. ESTJs are organized, practical, and decisive. They are natural leaders who value tradition and order.

ESFJ.name: The Consul
ESFJ.description: Extraordinarily caring, social and popular people, always eager to help. ESFJs are warm, cooperative, and responsible. They value harmony and helping others.

ISTP.name: The Virtuoso
ISTP.description: Bold and practical experimenters, masters of all kinds of tools. ISTPs are adaptable, logical, and hands-on. They love understanding how things work.

ISFP.name: The Adventurer
ISFP.description: Flexible and charming artists, always ready to explore new possibilities. ISFPs are gentle, caring, and artistic. They value personal freedom and authenticity.

ESTP.name: The Entrepreneur
ESTP.description: Smart, energetic and very perceptive people, truly enjoy living on the edge. ESTPs are spontaneous, pragmatic, and love action. They are natural problem-solvers.

ESFP.name: The Entertainer
ESFP.description: Spontaneous, energetic and enthusiastic people - life is never boring around them. ESFPs are friendly, outgoing, and love being around people. They bring joy and excitement to others.
